attributes.comment:
While I understand the need to raise fees from time to time, I write to you as a
concerned citizen in the process of adopting a daughter from China. My wife and I
have both already gone through the process of filing our I-600a and getting our
finger prints. We expected those costs as they were explanded to us by our
adoption agency. However, due to the lenght of time that it is taking to match
with our daughter, we like many other adopting parents, will need to renew the I-
600A and get new finger prints. This additional cost was not something we had
planned or budgeted for and while it will not stop us from adopting, it is a hardship.

Therefore, I ask that if you raise the cost for the initial filing of the I-600a and the
finger prints, you lower the cost for the renewal.

Thank you for your time.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by David W. McGoldrick
